title: In Russia and Ukraine Talks, European Leaders Seek Central Role in Continent’s Fate
sub_head: Macron, Scholz and others are trying to preserve a post-Cold War order that European countries aren’t prepared to forgo
body:
BERLIN—European shuttle diplomacy over the Ukraine crisis and Russia’s demands for an overhaul of the continent’s security rules has intensified in recent days, with Europe seeking to carve out a leadership role in resolving a conflict looming on its own turf.
On Monday and Tuesday, French President Emmanuel Macronsat down for hours of talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin in the Kremlin and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Kyiv. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, just back from the White House, is set to follow in Mr. Macron’s footsteps next week, while U.K. Foreign Secretary Liz Truss was due to travel to Moscow on Wednesday for talks with her Russian counterpart.
